Blog

We'll be blogging about new and changed features in our APIs, new applications and great re-usable collections of data. Want to guest blog? Get in touch.

  • Content sourcing for the Europeana Food and Drink Challenge

    The first Europeana Food & Drink challenge invites applicants to submit innovative tools, products and services using food and drink themed content from Europeana. Here we highlight ways to access content, and outline techniques that you can use to discover more via Europeana’s API.

    challenges food and drink

  • Who's Using What - Eero Hyvönen Developer Profile

    In this new series “Who’s Using What?”, EuropeanaTech Community Manager Gregory Markus from the Netherlands Institute for Sound and Vision, will be profiling the use of open source software within the EuropeanaTech Communty and the greater digital cultural heritage world at large. Software will range from storytelling tools that enable reuse to OCRs or libraries and everything in between. Enjoy!

    FLOSS

  • Who's Using What - Joe Germuska Developer Profile

    In this new series “Who’s using what?”, EuropeanaTech Community Manager Gregory Markus from the Netherlands Institute for Sound and Vision, will be profiling the use of open source software within the EuropeanaTech Communty and the greater digital cultural heritage world at large. Softwares will range from storytelling tools that enable reuse to OCRs or libraries and everything inbetween. Enjoy!

    FLOSS

  • Europeana Creative Design Challenge now open

    Europeana Creative is pleased to announce its final challenge encouraging you to design and submit products, applications and designs that reuse Europeana content in the theme of Design.

    Challenge Europeana Creative

    By Gregory Markus, Netherlands Institute for Sound and Vision

    By Valentine Charles (EuropeanaFoundation) and Milica Knezevic (Mathematical Institute SANU)

  • New translation method in the Europeana API

    We have recently released a new translation method in the Europeana API.

    API features translation

  • Europeana Labs update; take a Creative Challenge

    Welcome to the 2nd Europeana Labs newsletter. Every few months we bring you the latest news from Europeana, focussed on showcasing the exciting opportunities available to our developer community and inspiring you to be creative with Europe’s cultural heritage!

    Newsletter

  • 2nd Europeana Creative Challenge Workshop, Barcelona, 16 July 2014

    This blog post has been created to support the Europeana Creative Challenge workshop, Barcelona, 16 July 2014, held in association with Apps&Cultura. For those not able to attend, the event will be livestreamed at http://xmpp.iglor.es/appscultura_europeanalab/

    eCreative

  • Focus on re-usable datasets

    In April we added over 1 million new items to Europeana. The majority of these new collections are openly licensed and re-usable.

    Re-use Content Datasets

  • Can I use it?

    Uncovering the technology behind the simple search tool to discover reusable content available in both the Europeana portal and API.

    Re-use Rights Facets Technology

  • Welcome to the new Europeana Labs

    This new Europeana Labs website is intended to provide all you need to get started using the Europeana APIs. Learn about the data, see what others have created, and find out how to build simple but powerful queries to extract bespoke results from a dataset of over 30 million objects - books, photos of art and artefacts, audio clips and more.

    Introduction Beta
